SiteNameAddress: Site at Garden House Farm
Notes: Garden House Farm, Garden House Close, Monk Bretton.  This brownfield site is part of a wider site (H29) proposed for housing in the Local Plan Publication Draft 2016.  It is not anticipated that the part of the site included on the brownfield register be developed in isolation from the wider site.

SiteNameAddress: Land at Tankersley Lane
Notes: Land at Tankersley Lane.  This brownfield site is part of a wider site (AC30) proposed for housing in the Local Plan Publication Draft 2016.  It is not anticipated that the part of the site included on the brownfield register be developed in isolation from the wider site.  The proposed policy also requires any development to be the subject to the production of a masterplan covering the entire site and also proposed employment site reference HOY1.

SiteNameAddress: Former Reema Estate and adjoining land, off School Street
Notes: Former Reema Estate and adjoining land, off School Street, Thurnscoe. This brownfield site is part of a wider site (H1) proposed for housing in the Local Plan Publication Draft 2016.  It is not anticipated that the part of the site included on the brownfield register be developed in isolation from the wider site.

SiteNameAddress: Site at Blacker Lane
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Land north of Blacker Lane, Shafton.  This brownfield site is part of a wider site (H22) proposed for housing in the Local Plan Publication Draft 2016.  It is not anticipated that the part of the site included on the brownfield register be developed in isolation from the wider site.

SiteNameAddress: Land off Broadway
NonHousingDevelopment: The site is proposed for mixed use for housing and green space in the Local Plan Publication Draft 2016.  Only that part of the site that is brownfield is included on the brownfield register, excluding existing playing fields.  It is not intended that the brownfield element be developed in isolation from the wider site. The proposed policy requires development of the wider site to provide 3.25ha of playing pitches.

SiteNameAddress: Former wombwell high school
NonHousingDevelopment: The site is proposed for mixed use for housing and a primary school in the Local Plan Publication Draft 2016.  Two hectares of the site is proposed for a new primary school.

SiteNameAddress: Site of the former Foulstone School
Notes: The former Foulstone School.  This brownfield site is part of a wider site (H41) proposed for housing in the Local Plan Publication Draft 2016.  The proposed policy also requires any development to investigate options for either a small scale convenience shop that is in compliance with Local Plan Policy TC5 Local Shops or an extension to Darfield Local Centre that is in compliance with local and national policy to protect town centres.

SiteNameAddress: Site south of beever street
Notes: Land South of Beever Street Goldthorpe.  This brownfield site is part of a wider site (H52) proposed for housing in the Local Plan Publication Draft 2016.

SiteNameAddress: Land at Shaw Lane, Carlton
NonHousingDevelopment: This is part of a wider site proposed for mixed use for housing and green space in the Local Plan Publication Draft 2016.  The proposed policy requires that the area of green space known as Wharncliffe Woodmoor will be retained.  Only that part of the site that is brownfield is included on the brownfield register and excludes Wharncliffe Woodmoor.  The brownfield element could not be developed in isolation from the wider site.  The proposed policy also requires any development to be the subject to the production of a phased masterplan covering the entire site and also including proposed housing site H44.

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority

OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority

Notes: The application is for around 320 dwellings for a wider site, incorporating land within in Sheffield City Council.

SiteNameAddress: Grove street, barnsley
Southern fringe development site
NonHousingDevelopment: The overall site area is 3.6ha.  The potential for residential development is indicated in the region of 2.5ha, including a mixed use area.  The proposed Local Plan Publication 2016 policy states that mixed use developments that could include retail, residential and offices will be allowed.

SiteNameAddress: Courthouse campus
NonHousingDevelopment: The overall site area is 4ha.  The potential for residential development indicated is in the region of 2 hectares.  The proposed Local Plan Publication 2016 policy states that education and community facilities, offices, developments designed to support the creative and digital industries and residential units including live-work units will be allowed.
